Client
FAQ
Update
Final
Drafts
High
Priority
1.
How
do
I
add
or
update
a
method
of
payment?
Your
method
of
payment
can
be
updated
within
the
Account
section
of
your
SonderMind
account.
When
a
new
method
of
payment
is
added,
it
will
become
your
default.
You
may
update
the
default
method
of
payment
at
any
time.
If
you
are
replacing
the
method
of
payment
on
ﬁle,
a
new
card
must
be
added
before
the
existing
card
can
be
deleted.
For
billing
purposes,
we
cannot
remove
credit
card
information
on
active
client
accounts.
2.
How
do
I
add
or
update
my
insurance
information?
Your
insurance
can
be
updated
within
the
Account
section
of
your
SonderMind
account.
When
adding
insurance,
always
select
the
state
where
you
will
be
located
during
your
appointments.
We
submit
all
claims
based
on
your
location,
your
local
insurance
oﬃce
will
transfer
the
claim
as
needed
to
ensure
it
is
processed
correctly.
Before
saving
your
information,
double-check
that
it
is
correct,
as
inaccurate
information
can
lead
to
delays
or
issues
with
the
billing
process.
3.
SonderMind
Video
Telehealth®
EDITED: SonderMind Video Sessions - How to Guide
4.
How
much
will
my
appointment
cost
with
SonderMind?
(Insurance
and
Self
Pay)
The
exact
cost
depends
on
several
factors
including
your
location,
the
length
of
the
session
scheduled
with
your
provider,
and
the
type
of
care.
We
recommend
calling
your
insurance
company
directly
to
determine
what
your
out-of-pocket
costs
will
be
as
this
will
vary
based
on
your
individual
insurance
plan.
If
you
are
not
using
insurance,
please
submit
a
request
to
the
Support
team
via
our
Contact
Us
form
for
more
detailed
information
regarding
the
rates
in
your
state.
5.
What
if
I
don't
have
insurance
or
don't
want
to
use
my
insurance?
SonderMind
oﬀers
self-pay
rates
for
individuals
who
do
not
have
insurance
or
prefer
not
to
use
their
insurance
beneﬁts.
Due
to
regulations,
we
cannot
oﬀer
self-pay
rates
to
clients
who
have
Medicaid
as
their
primary
insurance.
The
exact
cost
of
your
care
depends
on
several
factors,
including
the
length
of
the
session
you
agree
on
with
your
provider
and
the
type
of
care.
6.
How
do
I
complete
my
SonderMind
Account?

To
complete
your
SonderMind
account,
follow
the
link
in
the
onboarding
email
you
receive
after
ﬁlling
out
our
match
request
form.
The
email
address
you
provided
will
be
used
to
log
in
and
a
password
must
be
created.
To
ﬁnish
completing
your
account
you
will
need
to:
●
conﬁrm
your
contact
information
●
add
your
insurance
or
self-pay
preferences
●
provide
a
method
of
payment
Once
your
account
is
complete
you
can
schedule
with
the
provider
match
that
best
ﬁts
your
needs.
Medium
Priority
1.
Does
SonderMind
oﬀer
Family
Therapy?
SonderMind
oﬀers
family
and
couples
therapy.
All
parties
must
provide
consent
to
treatment
but
are
not
required
to
create
individual
accounts
unless
they
choose
to
start
seeing
another
provider
individually.
At
this
time,
our
video
platform
can
only
support
two
devices.
Couples
and
family
sessions
will
need
to
be
held
in
person
or
all
parties
will
need
to
be
in
one
location
sharing
a
video.
2.
Does
SonderMind
offer
Group
Counseling?
SonderMind
offers
group
counseling
sessions.
All
parties
must
provide
consent
to
treatment
and
are
required
to
create
individual
accounts.
At
this
time
our
video
platform
can
only
support
two
devices.
Group
sessions
will
need
to
be
held
in
person.
3.
Does
SonderMind
oﬀer
therapy
for
Children/Minors?
Yes.
When
an
account
is
created
for
a
child
under
the
age
of
18,
the
account
should
reﬂect
the
child’s
legal
information,
but
parents
and
guardians
may
add
their
contact
details
and
list
themselves
as
a
contact
when
completing
the
account.
Additionally,
each
individual’s
account
must
include
a
unique
email
address.
If
a
Gmail
or
iCloud
address
is
used,
+1
may
be
added.
As
an
example,
the
email
address
will
look
like
this:
youremail+1@gmail.com
This
allows
email
communications
to
be
received
at
the
original
address
and
satisﬁes
the
requirement
for
a
unique
email.

4.
What
is
the
billing
process
if
I
am
using
multiple
insurances?
When
using
multiple
insurances,
you
will
only
be
charged
if
there
is
a
remaining
balance
after
we
have
heard
back
from
all
insurances
on
ﬁle.
Due
to
the
individual
nature
of
insurance
plans,
it
is
the
client's
responsibility
to
establish
a
coordination
of
beneﬁts
with
their
insurance
companies.
This
usually
takes
30-60
days
but
can
depend
on
your
coordination
of
beneﬁts
or
processing
delays.
After
your
claim
has
been
reviewed
and
processed,
we
will
bill
you
for
any
remaining
balance
from
your
session.
You
will
receive
an
invoice
3
days
before
the
scheduled
charge.
5.
What
type
of
mental
health
care
services
does
SonderMind
provide?
SonderMind
oﬀers
therapy
and
psychiatry
services
in
various
states
across
the
country.
We
work
with
providers
who
oﬀer
individual
support
as
well
as
family,
couples
and
group
sessions.
6.
Is
SonderMind
in
network
with
Medicaid?
SonderMind
providers
are
not
currently
in-network
with
Medicaid.
Federal
regulations
currently
prevent
mental
health
care
providers
from
accepting
self-pay
for
Medicaid
beneﬁciaries,
and
therefore,
we
cannot
oﬀer
self-pay
rates
to
clients
who
have
Medicaid
as
their
primary
insurance.
7.
Why
am
I
being
billed
several
months
after
an
appointment?
SonderMind
is
beholden
to
the
processing
timeline
of
each
insurance
company.
Charges
will
be
applied
once
insurance
has
processed
a
claim
and
identiﬁed
a
remaining
balance
owed.
In
some
cases,
your
card
will
be
charged
before
processing
if
beneﬁts
veriﬁcations
read
a
copay
or
coinsurance.
Typical
processing
timelines
are
30
to
90
days
but
can
be
delayed
for
several
reasons.
If
you
receive
an
invoice
for
an
appointment
that
happened
several
months
ago,
we
recommend
reviewing
or
requesting
an
Explanation
of
Beneﬁts
from
your
insurance
carrier.
Additionally,
you
can
ﬁll
out
our
<
Contact
Us
>
form
to
speak
with
our
team.
Low
Priority
1.
How
can
I
request
my
medical
records
from
SonderMind?
Per
our
Notice
of
Privacy
Practices
,
in
accordance
with
HIPAA,
you
have
the
right
to
receive
a
copy
of
your
medical
record.
You
can
choose
to
have
your
medical
records
sent
to
yourself
or
someone
else.
In
order
to
submit
your
request
please
complete
the
Records
Request
Form
.
Only
the
client
may
complete
this
form
.

2.
How
long
does
it
take
for
me
to
see
an
invoice
after
a
session?
Processing
timelines
vary
by
insurance
company.
Typical
processing
timelines
are
30
to
90
days.
If
this
time
has
elapsed
and
you
have
not
received
an
invoice,
we
recommend
reviewing
or
requesting
an
Explanation
of
Beneﬁts
from
your
insurance
carrier.
3.
Can
I
set
up
a
payment
plan
for
any
past
due
balances?
Payment
plans
may
be
available
for
your
past
due
balances
for
more
information
on
payment
plan
options
please
<
Contact
Us
>.
4.
Can
I
see
more
than
one
provider
through
SonderMind?
Individuals
may
use
SonderMind
to
see
more
than
one
provider,
we
recommend
contacting
your
insurance
carrier
to
conﬁrm
if
there
are
any
limitations
to
your
coverage.
5.
Can
SonderMind
bill
my
out-of-network
beneﬁts?
SonderMind
is
unable
to
bill
out-of-network
insurance
beneﬁts.
If
your
insurance
is
not
in-network,
we
have
self
pay
rates
available.
We
are
happy
to
provide
receipts
for
your
charges
but
cannot
guarantee
out-of-network
reimbursements
through
any
insurance
plan.
6.
How
do
I
ﬁnd
a
SonderMind
psychiatrist?
After
answering
a
few
questions,
online
or
over
the
phone,
we
use
proven
insights
to
ﬁnd
the
best
clinical
match
for
your
needs.
We'll
also
take
into
account
any
preferences
or
criteria
you
request,
like
gender
or
cultural
similarities.
We
do
the
work
of
ﬁnding
the
ideal
provider
for
you.
Click
Here
to
get
started
(
link
to
psychiatry
match
ﬂow
)

do
I
ﬁnd
a
SonderMind
Therapist?

a

questions,
online
or
over
the
phone,
we
use

to
ﬁnd

We'll

8.
What
if
I
think
I
have
been
charged
incorrectly?
SonderMind
invoices
are
based
on
the
responsibility
determined
by
your
individual
insurance
plan.
Your
insurance
carrier
will
provide
you
with
an
Explanation
of
Beneﬁts
for
each
claim
containing
details
about
the
payments
they
have
made
as
well
as
your
responsibility.
If
for
any
reason
these
amounts
do
not
match
<
Contact
Us
>
9.
What
do
I
do
if
my
therapist
has
not
joined
a
scheduled
session?
If
your
therapist
has
not
joined
a
scheduled
session
we
recommend
contacting
them
directly
using
the
messaging
application
in
your
account
or
the
contact
information
listed

in
their
proﬁle.
If
you
are
unable
to
connect
with
them
after
15
minutes
please
<
Contact
Us
>
for
further
assistance.
10.
How
do
I
use
my
Employee
Assistance
Program
(EAP)
beneﬁts?
SonderMind
accepts
Cigna
and
Optum
(United
Healthcare)
EAPs.
You
will
need
three
things
to
get
started
with
your
EAP:
authorization
number,
number
of
sessions,
and
eligibility
dates.
Any
sessions
beyond
what
is
covered
by
the
EAP
will
be
submitted
to
your
insurance,
or
as
self-pay.
EAP
information
can
be
added
within
the
Account
section
of
your
SonderMind
account.
11.
How
does
SonderMind
Work?
SonderMind
is
a
mental
health
provider
focused
on
providing
the
highest-quality
care.
We
will
connect
you
to
the
right
therapist
who
has
the
expertise
to
help
you
get
better,
faster,
and
is
available
now.
You
can
expect
to
have
a
session
scheduled
within
2
weeks,
rather
than
sitting
on
a
waiting
list.
Part
of
our
service
includes
handling
billing
and
working
with
your
insurance.
We
know
therapy
is
hard,
and
we're
here
to
help
do
the
hard
work.
For
more
information
please
take
a
look
at
Why
SonderMind
.

Medicare FAQ for LPC 
and LMFT CredentialingYour mental health home
Frequently Asked Questions
What are the different Medicare ‘Parts’?
In which states can I see Medicare clients?
What do I need to do to be credentialed with Medicare? Will you do everything for me, like with other payors?
Where can I get more information about this process?
Once I am effective with Medicare, can I also accept Medicare Advantage Plans?
What will the rates be for clients with Medicare and/or Medicare Advantage Plans?
Does this mean I will also be participating in Medicaid?
I don’t see my license type listed in some of the resources you linked or on the CMS website. Does that mean  
I’m not eligible?
What if I have another job and they are also credentialing me with Medicare?
Are there any separate documentation requirements for Medicare?
I don’t work with older clients so why would I join Medicare?
What if I don’t want to participate in Medicare? How can I opt out?
What are the different “Parts” of Medicare?
Medicare has four parts:
Part A (Hospital Insurance)
Part B (Medicare Insurance)
Part C (Medicare Advantage Plans)
Part D (Drug Coverage)
At SonderMind, our clients may use Medicare Part B (also called Medicare Fee-For-Service) and/or Medicare Part C 
(Medicare Advantage).

In which states can I see Medicare clients through SonderMind?
SonderMind is currently able to provide Medicare services in: Arizona, Colorado, Georgia, Indiana, Kentucky, Maryland, Mas -
sachusetts, Missouri, Ohio, Texas, and Virginia
What do I need to do to be credentialed with Medicare? Will you do everything for me, like with other payors?
The process for Medicare credentials is highly dependent on provider input and must be completed within a certain time 
frame  or Medicare will reject the application. Please keep this in mind once we begin the process and sign the required  
documents as soon as possible.
You will receive at least two signature requests from CMS (Center for Medicare and Medicaid Services) and PECOS (Provider 
Enrollment, Chain, and Ownership System). CMS will send the I&A (Identity and Access) Request which will prompt you to 
create an account in PECOS.
The process is as follows:
1. SonderMind will request an I&A. This gives us permission to apply for Medicare credentials on your behalf.  
 • You will receive an email from SonderMind notifying you that we have started the process so you can keep an eye  
  out for the email from CMS.
2. You will receive an email from CMS with a request to log into/create your account in PECOS and provide your signature 
agreeing to the I&A (authorizing SonderMind to apply on your behalf).
3. Once Medicare receives your I&A signature, SonderMind will complete your Medicare application(s).  
 • You will only need to approve I&A once, but we will need to submit individual applications for each of your  
     licensed states.
4. When Medicare receives the completed application(s), PECOS will send a signature request directly to you.  
This signature signals that you are aware that we submitted the application(s) and you approve.  
 • Please ensure you sign all application requests you receive if you are licensed in more than one state. 
5. Once Medicare receives your signature, they will process the application and send SonderMind an approval letter  
with your credentials and Medicare ID number(s). Your Medicare ID is also called a PTAN (Provider Transaction Account 
Number) and is unique to each application.  
 • You will be able to check the status of your enrollment on the PECOS  website .
6. SonderMind will update your credentials internally and you will receive an email that you are effective with Medicare  
in each applicable state. At that time you will begin to receive Medicare matches and can bring in Medicare clients.
Where can I get more information about this process?
You can review this FAQ  published by CMS.
Once I am effective with Medicare, can I also accept Medicare Advantage Plans?
Once you are credentialed with both  Medicare Part B and the payor that sponsors the Medicare Advantage plan  
(for example, Blue Cross or Optum), you will then be eligible to see clients with that payor’s Medicare Advantage product.
What will the rates be for clients with Medicare and/or Medicare Advantage Plans?
Rates for all SonderMind sessions are determined by the CPT code billed and this practice does not differ for Medicare  
or Medicare Advantage clients.  
Does this mean I will also be participating in Medicaid?
No. Medicare and Medicaid are separate entities and SonderMind does not participate in any Medicaid plans.
I don’t see my license type listed in some of the resources you linked. Does that mean I’m not eligible?
No, if you hold an independent counseling or marriage and family therapy license, you are eligible for Medicare with

an effective date of no sooner than 1/1/2024. CMS and other entities are still working on updating their resources and  
site information to adjust to the inclusion of these license types.
What if I have another job and they are also credentialing me with Medicare?
You may enroll in Medicare under any number of entities so SonderMind credentialing will not affect, or be affected by, any 
other party also applying for you. Each application is issued a separate PTAN (Provider Transaction Access Number) and acts 
as your unique identifier when billing for Medicare services.
Are there any separate documentation requirements for Medicare?
SonderMind’s current note templates cover the documentation requirements for Medicare. They are looking for notes that 
explain the medical necessity of services, that are able to indicate what clinical interventions are being used, how the client is 
responding to interventions, and a client’s progress in treatment. 
Additionally, for telehealth claims, they require the wording “Telehealth (audio/video)” or “Televideo” instead of only  
“Telehealth” or “Virtual.”
I don’t work with older clients, so why would I join Medicare?
Though a majority of Medicare clients are 65 years or older, Medicare coverage can also be obtained if an individual  
is disabled, has end-stage renal disease, or has been diagnosed with ALS. This means that you may see a wide variety  
of clients of many ages who have a Medicare plan.
What if I don’t want to participate in Medicare? How can I opt out?
At SonderMind, our mission is to ensure that all clients can access and utilize care, regardless of their circumstances.  
Therefore, we strongly encourage you to participate in Medicare . If you decide to opt-out, you will need to follow  
Medicare’s official opt-out process. Please review our opt-out FAQ  for more information.
In general, you must submit an opt-out affidavit in each of your licensed states. Your opt-out status will last for a period  
of two years and will auto-renew. Opting out means that you cannot receive payment through any Medicare program ,  
including Medicare Part B and Medicare Advantage plans and therefore cannot see clients with these types of insurance 
through SonderMind.
Unless a SonderMind provider chooses to follow the official Medicare opt-out process, they will be automatically enrolled  
in the Medicare credentialing process.
